repnme.cdata!:
Croatia - Reconstruction of Eastern
            Slavonia Baranja and Western Srijem Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated as highly
            satisfactory, sustainability as highly likely, despite a
            modest institutional development impact rating. Performances
            are rated as satisfactory in the case of the Bank, and
            highly satisfactory in the Borrower's case. Lessons
            first indicate that the denomination of the Loan in Deutsche
            Mark (DEM) and then in Euros helped mitigate the exchange
            rate risk, for denominating the Loan in the currency in
            which major contracts are procured helps limit the exchange
            rate risk. Given the evolution of the exchange rate, in 2003
            and 2004, when about Euro 30 million were disbursed, the
            denomination of the Loan in USD would have generated
            important losses. Second, by combining infrastructure and
            nature protection components, synergies are increased
            through the development of integrated approaches. In
            addition, treating mine clearing activities as part of a
            regular civil work contract, increases transparency and
            financial efficiency. Competitive selection of such
            activities within civil works contracts increased
            competition, and contributed to reducing prices
            significantly. Moreover, the inclusion of de-mining as part
            of regular civil works contracts ensured timeliness in
            implementation. Finally, the Bank should promote flexibility
            as an incentive to efficient Project management. The quality
            of procurement and the knowledge of Bank procedures by
            experienced teams, contributes to increase competition, and
            efficient financial management, eventually, translating into savings.

5083369.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

repnme.cdata!:
Croatia - Reconstruction Project for
            Eastern Slavonia, Baranja and Western Srijem

abstracts.cdata!:
The Reconstruction Project for Eastern
            Slavonia, Baranja, and Western Srijem seeks to repair and
            rebuild the war-damage water sector infrastructure while
            mitigating the negative environmental impact likely to be
            caused to an adjacent nature park by the restart of local
            agriculture. The project consists of four components. First,
            the wastewater management component will complete
            construction of the wastewater treatment for Vinkovci and
            extend the wastewater collection system thereby increasing
            the population served from 65 percent to 85 percent. Second,
            the flood control and drainage component will repair Baranja
            flood protection system. The work consists of repairing
            levees and draining systems and reconstructing pump
            stations. Third, the clearing of landmines component will
            verify that all construction sites are mine-free. Fourth,
            the nature protection component will develop and strengthen
            the State Directorate for the Protection of Nature and
            Environment, construct facilities and provide equipment.
